item.title: Greenpeace Faces Tough Start in Trial Over Dakota Access Pipeline Protests
item.description: The environmental group, battling a multimillion-dollar lawsuit over protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline, told the North Dakota Supreme Court ...

item.title: On Mexico’s Once-Packed Border, Few Migrants Remain
item.description: There has been a dramatic drop in the number of people gathering at the U.S. border and trying to cross. Can it help Mexico stave off President Trump’...

item.title: Drones Now Rule the Battlefield in the Ukraine-Russia War
item.description: Drones have changed the war in Ukraine, with soldiers adapting off-the-shelf models and swarming the front lines.

item.title: At Least One Killed After Car Drives Into Crowd in Germany
item.description: The police in Mannheim, in the country’s southwest, said the driver had been arrested and that they were investigating whether he had acted alone.

item.title: U.S.A.I.D. Memos Detail Human Costs of Cuts to Foreign Aid
item.description: The world is likely to see millions more malaria infections and 200,000 cases of paralytic polio each year, according to an agency whistle-blower.
